lead_paragraph: The Donetsk City Court said she directed mortar fire at a rebel-held checkpoint, resulting in the deaths during the height of the fighting in eastern Ukraine in June 2014.

headline.print_headline: Russia Gives Ukraine Pilot 22-Year Term for 2 Deaths
headline.main: Nadiya Savchenko, Ukrainian Pilot, Given 22 Years in Russian Reporters’ Deaths

snippet: The Donetsk City Court said she directed mortar fire at a rebel-held checkpoint, resulting in the deaths during the height of the fighting in eastern Ukraine in June 2014.
abstract: Russian court finds Ukrainian military pilot Lt Nadiya V Savchenko guilty and sentences her to 22 years in prison for involvement in deaths of two Russian journalists during fighting in Ukraine in June 2014.
